course.subject: ECON
course.name: Country Reports
course.description: International businesspersons must examine the suitability of countries as places for trade or finance. Country reports are an oft used tool for learning quickly about the key elements of the business environment in a country or regional economy. This course will focus on teaching students how to read such reports and how to write them with an eye toward broadening their knowledge of the international environment.

reviews.author: Wilson WAN
reviews.title: A simple course
reviews.comment_content: Basically, the course is about how to describe a country's economic information. For example, how to measure the factors of production, productivity, national income, equity and growth of a country. The contents are easily understandable.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor does not know how to teach. He just read the handouts and slides. Completely zero communication with students.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is okay. If you make revision well and you will get a decent grade. The final exam questions are standard and easily to answer.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is low, you just have to submit a mid-term project.
